description: Define the abstract base class for the Event Bus. It must support `publish(topic, message)` and `subscribe(topic, callback)`. It should be backend-agnostic (support Memory, Redis, NATS).
Create a reference implementation of the Event Bus using Python's `asyncio.Queue`. This allows local testing of multi-agent communication without external infrastructure.
Define the standard JSON schema for messages. Must include: `message_id`, `sender_pubkey`, `timestamp`, `performative` (REQUEST, PROPOSE, AGREE, REFUSE), and `content`.
Create the `IdentityManager` class. On agent initialization, generate an Ed25519 keypair. Save the private key securely. Expose the public key as the Agent ID.
Integrate Identity with the Event Bus. Before publishing, sign the message payload with the private key. On receipt, verify the signature against the sender's public key.
Implement a service where agents can 'register' their presence and capabilities. `register(agent_id, guild, capabilities)`. Other agents can query this to find peers.
